administering_body: Administrative Office of the Courts and Specialty Court Program Advisory Committee
effects: Act 58 of 2021 amends Ark. Code § 16‑10‑139 to define "specialty court program" to include pre‑adjudication programs, drug courts, Swift and Certain Accountability programs, and veterans treatment or DWI specialty courts.  It directs the Specialty Court Program Advisory Committee to evaluate programs using nationally recognized standards, ensure resources are directed to high‑risk, high‑need offenders, require evidence‑based practices, and ensure that specialty courts address substance dependency and mental‑health issues among participants【30507785040088†L39-L104】.  The Act expands authority for DHS and the courts to operate specialty court programs that prioritize treatment for substance use disorders.
